meanings.definition: Tending to nullify or hinder the effects of something.
meanings.sent1: The medicine had a counteractive effect on the virus, stopping it from spreading further.
meanings.sent2: The sunscreen's counteractive properties protected her skin from the harmful UV rays.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was so counteractive that it repelled any attempts to harm him.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was like a counteractive force against the negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The lock on the door was a counteractive measure to keep intruders out.
